repositories.brief_summary: Standard library enhancement with Option.blend, Apple Silicon performance fix, memory handling improvements, and error message refinements
repositories.new_features_summary: Added Option.blend function, introduced Sixtyfour memory chunk for unaligned access handling, and improved Apple Silicon store operations
repositories.new_features:
- **Option.blend function** added to standard library for combining optional values with a blending function ([#13995](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13995))
- **Sixtyfour memory chunk** introduced to CMM for handling 64-bit integer accesses that don't follow OCaml's relaxed memory model ([5f2b948](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/5f2b948a56124aa0864e202e0270475fbf97e21c))
- **Apple Silicon performance improvement** with `stlr` instruction emitted instead of `dmb ishld; str` for stores, reducing memory barrier overhead ([48b9b73](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/48b9b736ee719a5645de0a30db86710edb87751a))
- **Enhanced debugger source lookup** with fallback mechanism to search for module files in the loadpath, improving hit rate for installed packages ([#14063](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14063))
repositories.activity_summary: Error message improvements, runtime fixes, documentation updates, and ongoing work on module system enhancements
repositories.activity:
- **Error message enhancements** by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) for universal type variable mismatches ([#14076](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14076)) and tuple label mismatches ([#14070](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14070))
- **Memory profiler timing fix** by [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) preventing early memprof updates during minor GC ([#14057](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14057))
- **ThreadSanitizer improvements** by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) making TSan tests more deterministic and less flaky ([#14059](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14059))
- **Module system preparation** by [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) improving package handling in type printing for future modular explicits work ([#14067](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14067))
- **Module alias handling refinement** by [Clément Blaudeau](https://github.com/clementblaudeau) moving invalid alias detection from subtyping to merging phase ([#14066](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14066))
- **Documentation fixes** including alert attribute grammar correction by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) ([#14077](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14077)) and manual fibonacci definition consistency by [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) ([#14072](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14072))
- **Runtime improvements** with dynlink exception printer fix by [Etienne Millon](https://github.com/emillon) ([#14071](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14071)) and unused warning fix by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) ([#13956](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13956))
repositories.discussions_summary: Alert attribute usage confusion raised, multicore performance analysis ongoing, and manual modernization interest expressed
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Alert attribute confusion** identified by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) highlighting inconsistencies between documentation and actual usage patterns, particularly around item-attributes vs pattern-attributes ([#14078](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14078))
- **Multicore performance investigation** continues with [Nikos Gorogiannis](https://github.com/ngorogiannis) analyzing runtime lock waits in multicore analysis, showing significant performance gaps between multiprocessing and domain-based approaches in Infer ([#14047](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14047))
- **Manual documentation modernization** discussion initiated by [Nicholas Yang](https://github.com/NicholasLYang) exploring conversion to odoc format for improved contributor experience ([#13989](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13989))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on Apple Silicon optimization, runtime reliability, and error message quality improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Apple Silicon platform optimization** gaining attention with performance-specific fixes for ARM-based macOS systems, reflecting growing adoption of M1/M2 hardware in OCaml development
- **ThreadSanitizer reliability improvements** showing commitment to making multicore OCaml more robust through better testing infrastructure and false-positive elimination
- **Error message quality focus** with multiple PRs dedicated to improving type error reporting, particularly for universal variables and labeled constructs
- **Documentation accuracy emphasis** with systematic fixes to inconsistencies in manual examples and attribute usage guidelines
repositories.contributors_summary: Active contributions from core developers focusing on standard library, runtime, and tooling improvements
repositories.contributors:
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) implemented the new `Option.blend` function with comprehensive review feedback incorporation ([#13995](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13995))
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) improved error messages for universal type variables ([#14076](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14076)) and tuple label mismatches ([#14070](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14070)), and provided reviews across multiple PRs
- [KC Sivaramakrishnan](https://github.com/kayceesrk) optimized Apple Silicon performance with ARM-specific instruction selection improvements ([#14074](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14074))
- [@NickBarnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) fixed critical memory profiler timing issues during minor GC cycles ([#14057](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14057))
- [@OlivierNicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) enhanced ThreadSanitizer test reliability and reduced flakiness ([#14059](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14059))
- [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) contributed documentation fixes ([#14077](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14077)) and raised important UX issues around alert attribute usage ([#14078](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14078))
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) provided extensive reviews and technical guidance across multiple PRs, particularly on GC and performance-related changes
- [@samsa1](https://github.com/samsa1) advanced module system work with type printing improvements in preparation for modular explicits ([#14067](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14067))
- [@pirbo](https://github.com/pirbo) improved debugger source file resolution for better development experience ([#14063](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14063))

repositories.brief_summary: Bug fixes for pinned package handling and Windows Cygwin reliability improvements with updated build dependencies
repositories.new_features_summary: Embedded Cygwin setup executable for Windows fallback, updated vendor dependencies, and improved pinned package behavior
repositories.new_features:
- **Embedded Cygwin setup.exe** for Windows installations as a fallback when cygwin.com is unavailable, improving Windows platform reliability ([#6526](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6526))
- **Updated build dependencies** including dune to 3.19.0, cppo to 1.8.0, ocamlgraph to 2.2.0, uutf to 1.0.4, and patch to 3.0.0~beta1 ([#6527](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6527))
- **OCaml 5.4 build compatibility** when using `./configure --without-dune` ([#6527](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6527))
- **Fixed `opam install . --deps-only`** to properly respect local package constraints when conflicts exist with already installed packages ([#6530](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6530))
- **Prevented source fetching** during simulated pin operations to avoid updating internal sources incorrectly ([#6533](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6533))
- **Corrected reinstall triggers** for simulated pinned packages to use newly simulated package information rather than existing pins ([#6522](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6522))
repositories.activity_summary: Focus on resolving pinned package simulation bugs and Windows platform improvements with comprehensive test coverage additions
repositories.activity:
- **Pin simulation handling** improvements by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) addressing multiple edge cases in `--deps-only` operations ([#6530](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6530), [#6533](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6533), [#6522](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6522))
- **Windows platform reliability** enhancements by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) with embedded Cygwin setup executable and Alpine 22 depexts fixes ([#6526](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6526))
- **Comprehensive test suite expansion** with new reftests covering pin operations, working directory handling, and simulated pin scenarios ([#6530](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6530), [#6533](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6533))
- **Build system updates** resolving stack overflow issues in repository updates and patch handling edge cases ([#6527](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6527))
repositories.trends_summary: Increased focus on fixing edge cases in package pinning operations and improving Windows platform support
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Package pinning workflow improvements** with multiple PRs addressing simulation and dependency resolution edge cases
- **Platform-specific reliability enhancements** particularly for Windows environments with embedded fallback mechanisms
- **Test coverage expansion** for complex scenarios involving pinned packages and working directory operations
- **Dependency management refinements** with updated vendor dependencies and compatibility improvements for newer OCaml versions
repositories.contributors_summary: Two core maintainers handled all development work focusing on bug fixes and platform improvements
repositories.contributors:
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) implemented multiple pin-related bug fixes including simulated pin constraint handling ([#6530](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6530)), source fetching prevention ([#6533](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6533)), and reinstall trigger corrections ([#6522](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6522)), while adding comprehensive test coverage for these scenarios
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) enhanced Windows platform support with embedded Cygwin setup.exe ([#6526](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6526)), updated multiple build dependencies to resolve compatibility issues ([#6527](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6527)), and provided PR reviews on pin-related changes
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) contributed code review and testing feedback on the Windows improvements and provided platform-specific insights for the Cygwin embedding work

repositories.brief_summary: Major refactoring week with dune exec behavior revert and extensive internal reorganization for improved RPC support
repositories.new_features_summary: Reverted dune exec changes from 3.19.0, enhanced package management with portable depexts, and improved RPC server architecture
repositories.new_features:
- **Reverted `dune exec` behavior changes** introduced in version 3.19.0 that caused issues with process group handling and standard input/output inheritance ([#11879](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11879))
- **Enhanced package management** with new portable depexts support allowing conditional external dependencies based on system constraints ([120e8ac](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/120e8ac10a5f066251d1a4e81bd105ab711b26c3), [f6c1e4e](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/f6c1e4e7b57b6eae2caccd23f3e1d081aa8451e6))
- **Improved RPC server architecture** with better type safety and generic build argument handling for enhanced client-server communication ([83da0d3](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/83da0d310a24897dee59a4a6acad75e3ef5c9461), [94c59ca](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/94c59ca177842185147f389806e9d23942abbc13))
- **Display warning when dune builds via RPC** to inform users about background build processes and lock status ([e117ae2](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/e117ae277745e104c791368cbb1262a4ca53af20))
repositories.activity_summary: Extensive internal refactoring focused on moving core modules to dune_lang and updating CI to OCaml 5.3.x
repositories.activity:
- **Internal code organization improvements** with several core modules moved from `dune_rules` to `dune_lang` including `Mode_conf`, `Include_subdirs`, `Stanza_common`, and `Alias_conf` ([31208a5](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/31208a5b77f39f59e68378275bc4cae37e4c0cf2), [9eee26c](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/9eee26c2a95af4b1062ca0ecede6b488cb5c9acb), [abe7db6](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/abe7db64410270ae65d6d1d8c3f0db35d85f6378))
- **CI infrastructure updates** with OCaml version bump from 5.2.x to 5.3.x across build matrix and disabled inline-tests on macOS for js_of_ocaml ([817838f](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/817838f61777ae17f01d37033378f01e16919c37), [e32c9be](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/e32c9be38df64a1b821ffb4dd7480567b857d805))
- **Test infrastructure improvements** with promoted module tests and foreign library test updates using `:standard` compilation flags ([938bbc9](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/938bbc92d7e4c7a32b1f10bca4d23d18e17e4739), [c20963f](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/c20963ffb84aa938ce7463de20831508eaf75ab1))
- **Package management solver enhancements** with simpler default platforms configuration and improved lockdir handling ([9f128e8](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/9f128e897c63b3f564962cd9073219ba3d48baa4))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on internal code organization and architectural improvements with emphasis on RPC infrastructure modernization
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Architectural consolidation** with systematic movement of core language parsing and configuration components from `dune_rules` to `dune_lang` for better separation of concerns
- **RPC infrastructure modernization** with improved type safety, generic build argument handling, and better user feedback about background operations
- **Package management evolution** towards more portable and flexible dependency handling with conditional depexts and improved solver capabilities
- **CI/Testing infrastructure modernization** with OCaml version upgrades and platform-specific test adaptations
repositories.contributors_summary: Active development led by Ali Caglayan, Etienne, Stephen Sherratt, and Rudi Grinberg with ongoing package management discussions
repositories.contributors:
- [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) implemented the `dune exec` behavior revert ([#11879](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11879)), led multiple internal refactoring efforts moving modules to `dune_lang` ([31208a5](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/31208a5b77f39f59e68378275bc4cae37e4c0cf2), [9eee26c](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/9eee26c2a95af4b1062ca0ecede6b488cb5c9acb), [abe7db6](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/abe7db64410270ae65d6d1d8c3f0db35d85f6378)), and managed CI infrastructure updates including OCaml 5.3.x migration ([817838f](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/817838f61777ae17f01d37033378f01e16919c37))
- [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) developed RPC server improvements including build warning display when using RPC ([#11833](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11833)), enhanced global lock information exposure ([94c59ca](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/94c59ca177842185147f389806e9d23942abbc13)), and contributed to package management with portable lockdir depexts ([#11828](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11828))
- [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) advanced OxCaml testing suite integration through ongoing code review discussions and feature development work on [#11826](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/11826)
- [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) provided technical guidance on OxCaml integration, architectural decisions for language extension support, and strategic direction for internal module organization ([#11826](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/11826))
- [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) contributed to package management discussions with detailed submodule support analysis and workaround solutions for dependency handling ([#11606](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11606))

repositories.brief_summary: Performance issue reported for Fl_dynload.load_packages degradation in large OPAM switches
repositories.activity_summary: One performance issue reported affecting package loading in large OCaml environments
repositories.activity:
- Performance degradation issue reported in **package loading functionality** by [Emilio Jesús Gallego Arias](https://github.com/ejgallego), identifying that `Fl_dynload.load_packages` experiences super-linear slowdown in large OPAM switches ([#109](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/109))
- Technical analysis identified `Fl_package_base.requires_deeply` as the **root cause function** consuming excessive runtime during package dependency resolution ([#109](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/109))
repositories.contributors_summary: Emilio Jesús Gallego Arias reported a performance issue and provided technical analysis
repositories.contributors: - [Emilio Jesús Gallego Arias](https://github.com/ejgallego) reported performance degradation in `Fl_dynload.load_packages` with detailed benchmarking data showing 20x slowdown in large OPAM environments and provided initial technical analysis identifying the problematic function ([#109](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/109))

repositories.brief_summary: Release preparation with OCaml 5.4 support, WebAssembly optimizations, and DOM API additions to js_of_ocaml
repositories.new_features_summary: OCaml 5.4 support, WebAssembly optimizations, DataView bigarrays implementation, matchMedia API, and string constants optimization
repositories.new_features:
- **OCaml 5.4 support** with runtime primitives and compiler compatibility changes ([#2030](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2030))
- **WebAssembly integer optimizations** avoiding ref.i31/i31.get_s for better V8 performance ([#2032](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2032))
- **DataView primitives for WebAssembly bigarrays** improving performance by optimizing typed array access from Wasm ([#1979](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1979))
- **Imported string constants mechanism** for WebAssembly using JS String Builtins proposal instead of launcher script storage ([#2022](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2022))
- **window.matchMedia and MediaQueryList API** added to DOM bindings for responsive web development ([#2017](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2017))
- **WebAssembly effects disabling** via `--effects disabled` flag to avoid JavaScript function call costs with JSPI ([#2026](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2026))
- **Compiler optimization improvements** with more effective inlining passes and laziness increases for better code generation ([#2027](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2027), [#2029](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2029))
- **Runtime method lookup fix** for WebAssembly addressing lookup failures ([#2034](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2034))
- **Benchmark infrastructure expansion** adding bigarrays, bin_prot, and lexifi-g2pp benchmarks for performance testing ([#2025](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2025))
repositories.activity_summary: Active release preparation with 10 PRs merged focusing on WebAssembly optimizations and OCaml 5.4 compatibility
repositories.activity:
- **Release preparation activities** by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) preparing version 5.4 with comprehensive changes across compiler and runtime ([#2030](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2030))
- **Cross-compilation unit arity propagation** merged after extensive testing and feedback from [Ricky Vetter](https://github.com/rickyvetter) and [Ty Overby](https://github.com/TyOverby), enabling better optimization across compilation units ([#1594](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1594))
- **WebAssembly runtime improvements** with fixes to method lookup, string constant handling, and bigarray implementations by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ([#2033](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2033), [#2034](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2034))
- **Compiler optimization enhancements** improving inlining effectiveness and dead code elimination passes to reach fixpoint faster ([#2027](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2027))
- **Performance testing infrastructure** expanded with additional benchmarks including mathematical computations and data serialization tests ([#2025](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2025))
repositories.discussions_summary: Promise API integration discussion and WASM function export limitations explored
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Promise API integration proposal** by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) to adopt Funkyworker's type-safe Promise API implementation, with discussion from [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) about existing brr bindings ([#2031](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2031))
- **WASM function export limitations** discussed by [NSlash951](https://github.com/myfreess) regarding static export definitions versus dynamic OCaml function allocation, with technical explanation from [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ([#2028](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2028))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on WebAssembly performance optimization and OCaml 5.x ecosystem compatibility improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **WebAssembly optimization focus** with multiple PRs targeting V8 performance improvements through DataView primitives and integer optimizations
- **OCaml 5.x compatibility work** with infrastructure changes to support new language features and runtime primitives
- **Performance benchmarking expansion** adding comprehensive test suites for mathematical and data processing workloads
- **Build system integration improvements** with better support for separate compilation and cross-module optimization
repositories.contributors_summary: Two primary contributors [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) and [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) handled most development with [@toastal](https://github.com/toastal) contributing DOM API additions
repositories.contributors:
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) led release preparation implementing OCaml 5.4 support ([#2030](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2030)), compiler optimizations ([#2027](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2027), [#2029](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2029)), inlining cache improvements ([#2014](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2014)), and merged cross-compilation arity propagation ([#1594](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1594))
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) implemented WebAssembly optimizations including integer performance improvements ([#2032](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2032)), DataView bigarray implementation ([#1979](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1979)), string constants mechanism ([#2022](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2022)), effects disabling feature ([#2026](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2026)), runtime fixes ([#2033](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2033), [#2034](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2034)), and expanded benchmark suite ([#2025](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2025))
- [@toastal](https://github.com/toastal) contributed DOM API enhancements by adding window.matchMedia and MediaQueryList support for responsive web development ([#2017](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2017))
- [NSlash951](https://github.com/myfreess) initiated discussion about WASM function export capabilities ([#2028](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2028))
- [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) proposed Promise API integration exploring type-safe JavaScript Promise bindings ([#2031](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2031))

repositories.brief_summary: Active development with new CLI options, template documentation, flambda2 optimizations, and runtime improvements
repositories.new_features_summary: New `-o` flag for ocamldep, `-I-paths/-H-paths` flags, template documentation, and continuation shortcuts in flambda2
repositories.new_features:
- Added **`-o` output flag** to ocamldep for writing dependencies to a file instead of stdout ([#4045](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4045))
- Introduced **`-I-paths` and `-H-paths` flags** to replace the `-libloc` mechanism, allowing direct specification of available files via path files ([#3974](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3974))
- Implemented **flambda2 continuation shortcuts** optimization for better performance in apply_cont operations ([#3545](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3545))
- Enhanced **product array error messages** to be more informative for mixed product arrays ([#4105](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4105))
- Fixed **genprintval layout bug** preventing calls to `is_null` on `value` layout ([#4091](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4091))
- Added **`parameterised_modules: true` to `-config`** output for feature detection ([#4021](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4021))
- Fixed **binary emitter VEX encoding bug** in x86 code generation ([#4069](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4069))
- Improved **AST version mismatch error messages** for better user experience ([#4084](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4084))
- Added comprehensive **OxCaml template documentation** including introduction, reference, and examples ([#4106](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4106))
repositories.activity_summary: Runtime improvements, type system enhancements, bug fixes, and systhreads4 reorganization
repositories.activity:
- **Runtime optimizations** including non-hugepage fiber stacks by default ([#4082](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4082)) and avoiding clearing prefetch buffer during GC marking ([#4051](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4051))
- **Systhreads4 reorganization** by moving stubs into runtime4 itself for better integration ([#4099](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4099))
- **Type system improvements** with mode crossing for non-principal types ([#4077](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4077)) and fixed polymorph parameter handling ([#4102](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4102))
- **Domain annotations** for `'a Domain.t` as `mod portable contended with 'a` ([#3829](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3829)) and `Thread.Portable.create` function annotations ([#3808](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3808))
- **Register allocation optimizations** with shortcuts in overlap computation for linscan and greedy allocators ([#4079](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4079))
- **Build system enhancements** including stack checks and multidomain features in build_ocaml_compiler ([#4085](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4085))
- **Code generation fixes** including CMM subtraction generation ([#4060](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4060)) and LLVM-MCA marker emission ([#4023](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4023))
- **Cleanup activities** removing obsolete CR ocaml 5 domains comments ([#4063](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4063)) and deleting unused Flambda_kind.to_lambda ([#4090](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4090))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on performance, runtime optimization, and developer experience improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Performance-focused development** with multiple optimization efforts in flambda2, register allocation, and runtime components
- **Developer experience improvements** through better error messages, comprehensive documentation, and enhanced CLI tools
- **Runtime modernization** including fiber stack management, memory handling optimizations, and threading system reorganization
- **Type system advancement** with continued work on modes, layouts, and domain annotations for better safety and performance
repositories.contributors_summary: Active development with issue closure and ongoing PR work on advanced language features
repositories.contributors:
- [Guillaume Bury](https://github.com/Gbury) closed the continuation aliases improvement issue ([#3210](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3210)) on June 3rd after working on better Flambda2 optimization features
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) continued working on code documentation quality, discussing copy-paste ready examples in jane/doc/extensions with [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) ([#4016](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4016))
- [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian) continued development on runtime quotations with a large PR introducing AST-like structures and staging support ([#4395](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/pull/4395))
- Multiple contributors implemented **35 commits** during the week covering various aspects from CLI improvements to runtime optimizations and type system enhancements

group_summaries.brief_summary: Major development week with dune/opam improvements, js_of_ocaml 5.4 release, and performance optimization focus across repositories
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Dune exec revert, opam Windows improvements, js_of_ocaml OCaml 5.4 support, and enhanced package management capabilities
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Reverted dune exec behavior changes** from version 3.19.0 in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) that caused process group and I/O issues ([ocaml/dune#11879](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11879))
- **Enhanced package management** with portable depexts support in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) for conditional external dependencies ([120e8ac](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/120e8ac10a5f066251d1a4e81bd105ab711b26c3))
- **Embedded Cygwin setup executable** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) for Windows fallback when cygwin.com is unavailable ([ocaml/opam#6526](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6526))
- **OCaml 5.4 support** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) with runtime primitives and compiler compatibility ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2030](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2030))
- **WebAssembly integer optimizations** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) avoiding ref.i31/i31.get_s for better V8 performance ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2032](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2032))
- **window.matchMedia API** added to [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) DOM bindings for responsive web development ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2017](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2017))
- **Fixed opam install . --deps-only** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) to respect local package constraints when conflicts exist ([ocaml/opam#6530](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6530))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Major architectural improvements** across [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) and [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) with significant refactoring and bug fixes
- **WebAssembly and OCaml 5.x compatibility focus** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) with 10 PRs merged for version 5.4 release preparation
- **Performance optimization theme** spanning multiple repositories including package loading ([ocaml/ocamlfind#109](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/109)) and WebAssembly runtime improvements
- **Build system modernization** in [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) and [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with dune format migration and CI updates to OCaml 5.3.x
- **Minimal activity** in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin), [ocaml/opam-file-format](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-file-format), [ocaml-dune/spawn](https://github.com/ocaml-dune/spawn), and [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) with only dependency updates and maintenance issues
group_summaries.activity_summary: Extensive internal refactoring in dune, comprehensive testing additions in opam, and active js_of_ocaml release preparation work
group_summaries.activity:
- **Internal code organization** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with core modules moved from `dune_rules` to `dune_lang` for better separation of concerns ([31208a5](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/31208a5b77f39f59e68378275bc4cae37e4c0cf2), [9eee26c](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/9eee26c2a95af4b1062ca0ecede6b488cb5c9acb))
- **CI infrastructure modernization** across multiple repositories with OCaml 5.3.x migration in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) ([817838f](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/817838f61777ae17f01d37033378f01e16919c37)) and build system improvements in [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) ([ocaml/odoc#1338](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1338))
- **Pin simulation handling improvements** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) addressing edge cases in `--deps-only` operations with comprehensive test coverage ([ocaml/opam#6530](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6530), [ocaml/opam#6533](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6533))
- **Cross-compilation optimization** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) with unit arity propagation merged after extensive testing ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#1594](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1594))
- **Test infrastructure cleanup** in [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) removing `/tmp` usage for cross-platform compatibility ([ocaml/odoc#1350](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1350))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Package management coordination** between [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) and [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) with [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) contributing to both dune dependency discussions ([ocaml/dune#11606](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11606)) and opam access controls ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1535](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1535))
- **Build tooling evolution** with [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) driving OCaml 5.3.x adoption and [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) modernizing dune format usage ([ocaml/odoc#1338](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1338))
- **Performance optimization theme** spanning [ocaml/ocamlfind](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind) package loading issues ([ocaml/ocamlfind#109](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/109)) and [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) WebAssembly runtime improvements
- **Shared contributor activity** with [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) reviewing across [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) ([ocaml/dune#11826](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/11826)) and [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) build system changes
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Promise API integration proposal** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) exploring type-safe Promise bindings with feedback from [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) about existing brr alternatives ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2031](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2031))
- **WASM function export limitations** discussed in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) regarding static export definitions versus dynamic OCaml function allocation ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2028](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2028))
- **Repository access control discussion** in [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) with [Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho) requesting master branch protection after accidental commit ([ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1535](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp/issues/1535))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Architectural consolidation** across build tools with [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) moving core components to `dune_lang` and [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) exposing modular libraries ([ocaml/odoc#1349](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1349))
- **OCaml 5.x ecosystem readiness** with [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) implementing 5.4 support and [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) upgrading CI to 5.3.x
- **WebAssembly optimization focus** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) with multiple performance improvements targeting V8 runtime efficiency
- **Cross-platform reliability improvements** spanning Windows support in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) ([ocaml/opam#6526](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6526)) and platform-agnostic testing in [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) ([ocaml/odoc#1350](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1350))
- **Performance-first development** with package loading optimization needs identified in [ocaml/ocamlfind](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind) and runtime improvements across multiple tools

group_summaries.brief_summary: Active OCaml development with compiler optimizations, tooling updates, and package compilation fixes
group_summaries.new_features_summary: New CLI flags, flambda2 optimizations, OCaml 5.2.0minus-10 support, and comprehensive OxCaml documentation
group_summaries.new_features:
- Added **`-o` output flag** to ocamldep for writing dependencies to a file instead of stdout ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4045](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4045))
- Introduced **`-I-paths` and `-H-paths` flags** to replace the `-libloc` mechanism, allowing direct specification of available files via path files ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3974](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3974))
- Implemented **flambda2 continuation shortcuts** optimization for better performance in apply_cont operations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3545](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3545))
- Enhanced **product array error messages** to be more informative for mixed product arrays ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4105](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4105))
- Added **`parameterised_modules: true` to `-config`** output for feature detection ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4021](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4021))
- Fixed **genprintval layout bug** preventing calls to `is_null` on `value` layout ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4091](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4091))
- Fixed **binary emitter VEX encoding bug** in x86 code generation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4069](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4069))
- Improved **AST version mismatch error messages** for better user experience ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4084](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4084))
- Added comprehensive **OxCaml template documentation** including introduction, reference, and examples ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4106](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4106))
- Updated **OCaml compiler compatibility** to support version 5.2.0minus-10 with updated magic numbers for CMI, AST, CMT, CMS, and index files ([oxcaml/merlin#144](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/144))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Primary development activity** concentrated in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) with 35 commits covering compiler optimizations, new CLI features, and documentation improvements
- **Tooling maintenance** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with compatibility updates for OCaml 5.2.0minus-10 release ([oxcaml/merlin#144](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/144))
- **Package stability issues** reported in [janestreet/opam-repository](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository) affecting compilation of ocaml-index and base packages ([janestreet/opam-repository#60](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/60), [janestreet/opam-repository#61](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/61))
- **No activity recorded** in [oxcaml/opam-repository](https://github.com/oxcaml/opam-repository) and [oxcaml/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/js_of_ocaml) repositories during this period
group_summaries.activity_summary: Runtime optimizations, type system enhancements, build improvements, and package maintenance work
group_summaries.activity:
- **Runtime optimizations** including non-hugepage fiber stacks by default ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4082](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4082)) and avoiding clearing prefetch buffer during GC marking ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4051](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4051))
- **Systhreads4 reorganization** by moving stubs into runtime4 itself for better integration ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4099](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4099))
- **Type system improvements** with mode crossing for non-principal types ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4077](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4077)) and fixed polymorph parameter handling ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4102](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4102))
- **Domain annotations** for `'a Domain.t` as `mod portable contended with 'a` ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3829](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3829)) and `Thread.Portable.create` function annotations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3808](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3808))
- **Register allocation optimizations** with shortcuts in overlap computation for linscan and greedy allocators ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4079](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4079))
- **Build system enhancements** including stack checks and multidomain features in build_ocaml_compiler ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4085](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4085))
- **Version maintenance work** coordinated between [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) and [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) to align Merlin with latest OCaml development release ([oxcaml/merlin#144](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/144))
- **Package compilation issues** identified by [Nathan Farlow](https://github.com/nathanfarlow) affecting Jane Street extensions branch with missing yojson dependency ([janestreet/opam-repository#61](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/61)) and syntax errors in base package ([janestreet/opam-repository#60](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/60))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Compiler-tooling coordination** between [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) and [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with magic number updates to maintain compatibility with OCaml 5.2.0minus-10 release ([oxcaml/merlin#144](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/144))
- **Package ecosystem maintenance** with compilation issues in [janestreet/opam-repository](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository) potentially affecting users of Jane Street extensions who depend on ocaml-lsp-server integration ([janestreet/opam-repository#60](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/60))
- **Development workflow synchronization** between internal Jane Street processes and public OxCaml releases, with selective commit inclusion for public distribution ([oxcaml/merlin#144](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/144))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Internal codebase alignment** discussion in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) regarding which commits are necessary for OxCaml versus internal usage, with [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) managing commit reversion decisions ([oxcaml/merlin#144](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/144))
- **Documentation quality collaboration** between [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) and [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) on copy-paste ready examples in jane/doc/extensions ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4016](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4016))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Performance-focused development** with multiple optimization efforts in flambda2 continuation shortcuts ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3545](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3545)), register allocation improvements ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4079](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4079)), and runtime components
- **Developer experience improvements** through enhanced error messages ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4105](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4105), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4084](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4084)), comprehensive documentation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4106](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4106)), and enhanced CLI tools ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4045](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4045))
- **Runtime modernization** including fiber stack management ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4082](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4082)), memory handling optimizations, and threading system reorganization ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4099](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4099))
- **Type system advancement** with continued work on modes ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4077](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4077)), layouts, and domain annotations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3829](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3829)) for better safety and performance
- **Collaborative maintenance model** with coordinated releases between compiler development and tooling updates, ensuring ecosystem compatibility across multiple repositories

group_summaries.brief_summary: Standard library enhancement with Option.blend, Apple Silicon performance optimizations, and runtime reliability improvements
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Option.blend function added, Apple Silicon store operations optimized, and unaligned memory access handling improved
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Option.blend function** added to standard library by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) for combining optional values with a blending function ([ocaml/ocaml#13995](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13995))
- **Sixtyfour memory chunk** introduced to CMM for handling 64-bit integer accesses that don't follow OCaml's relaxed memory model ([5f2b948](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/5f2b948a56124aa0864e202e0270475fbf97e21c))
- **Apple Silicon performance improvement** by [KC Sivaramakrishnan](https://github.com/kayceesrk) with `stlr` instruction emitted instead of `dmb ishld; str` for stores, reducing memory barrier overhead ([48b9b73](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/48b9b736ee719a5645de0a30db86710edb87751a))
- **Enhanced debugger source lookup** by [Pierre Boutillier](https://github.com/pirbo) with fallback mechanism to search for module files in the loadpath, improving hit rate for installed packages ([ocaml/ocaml#14063](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14063))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Primary activity** concentrated in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) repository with significant standard library enhancements, platform-specific optimizations, and runtime improvements
- **No activity** recorded in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) repository during this week
- **Standard library evolution** continues with new utility functions and enhanced debugging capabilities
- **Performance focus** on Apple Silicon platform with ARM-specific optimizations
- **Quality improvements** across error messages, documentation, and runtime reliability
group_summaries.activity_summary: Error message improvements, memory profiler fixes, ThreadSanitizer enhancements, and module system preparation work
group_summaries.activity:
- **Error message enhancements** by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) for universal type variable mismatches ([ocaml/ocaml#14076](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14076)) and tuple label mismatches ([ocaml/ocaml#14070](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14070))
- **Memory profiler timing fix** by [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) preventing early memprof updates during minor GC ([ocaml/ocaml#14057](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14057))
- **ThreadSanitizer improvements** by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) making TSan tests more deterministic and less flaky ([ocaml/ocaml#14059](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14059))
- **Module system preparation** by [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) improving package handling in type printing for future modular explicits work ([ocaml/ocaml#14067](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14067))
- **Module alias handling refinement** by [Clément Blaudeau](https://github.com/clementblaudeau) moving invalid alias detection from subtyping to merging phase ([ocaml/ocaml#14066](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14066))
- **Documentation fixes** including alert attribute grammar correction by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) ([ocaml/ocaml#14077](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14077)) and manual fibonacci definition consistency by [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) ([ocaml/ocaml#14072](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14072))
- **Runtime improvements** with dynlink exception printer fix by [Etienne Millon](https://github.com/emillon) ([ocaml/ocaml#14071](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14071)) and unused warning fix by [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) ([ocaml/ocaml#13956](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13956))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Alert attribute confusion** identified by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) highlighting inconsistencies between documentation and actual usage patterns, particularly around item-attributes vs pattern-attributes ([ocaml/ocaml#14078](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14078))
- **Multicore performance investigation** continues with [Nikos Gorogiannis](https://github.com/ngorogiannis) analyzing runtime lock waits in multicore analysis, showing significant performance gaps between multiprocessing and domain-based approaches in Infer ([ocaml/ocaml#14047](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14047))

weekly_summary.new_features_summary: Option.blend function, Apple Silicon optimizations, CLI improvements, package management enhancements, and comprehensive ecosystem releases
weekly_summary.new_features:
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Option.blend function** added to standard library by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) for combining optional values with a blending function ([ocaml/ocaml#13995](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13995))
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Apple Silicon performance improvement** by [KC Sivaramakrishnan](https://github.com/kayceesrk) with `stlr` instruction emitted instead of `dmb ishld; str` for stores, reducing memory barrier overhead ([48b9b73](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/48b9b736ee719a5645de0a30db86710edb87751a))
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Enhanced debugger source lookup** by [Pierre Boutillier](https://github.com/pirbo) with fallback mechanism to search for module files in the loadpath, improving hit rate for installed packages ([ocaml/ocaml#14063](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14063))
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **New CLI flags** for ocamldep with `-o` output flag to write dependencies to files instead of stdout ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4045](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4045)) and `-I-paths`/`-H-paths` flags for direct file specification via path files ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3974](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3974))
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Flambda2 continuation shortcuts** optimization implemented for better performance in apply_cont operations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#3545](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/3545))
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **OCaml 5.2.0minus-10 support** added to Merlin with updated magic numbers for CMI, AST, CMT, CMS, and index files ([oxcaml/merlin#144](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/144))
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Yojson 3.0.0** major release with optimized JSON parsing and printing library by Tarides maintainers ([ocaml/opam-repository@e75d4c0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/e75d4c02d2e28a40b4957ca6fce6cb6264220516))

- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Reverted dune exec behavior changes** from version 3.19.0 that caused process group and I/O issues ([ocaml/dune#11879](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11879))
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Enhanced package management** with portable depexts support in dune for conditional external dependencies ([120e8ac](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/commit/120e8ac10a5f066251d1a4e81bd105ab711b26c3))
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **OCaml 5.4 support** in js_of_ocaml with runtime primitives and compiler compatibility ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2030](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2030))
